thread.title: Vitale is latest to pick UNC to win it all
thread.title_full: Vitale is latest to pick UNC to win it all

title: Vitale is latest to pick UNC to win it all
text:
Vitale is latest to pick UNC to win it all 
Posted 3:45 p.m. yesterday Your friends e-mail addresses (comma separated): * Subject: * You must enter the characters with black color that stand out from the other characters More on this 
In his preseason rankings released Wednesday, ESPN's Dick Vitale chose the University of North Carolina Tar Heels to claim their seventh NCAA men's basketball championship. 
"Experience and depth are keys to the championship. Plus a healthy Marcus Paige will help," Vitale wrote. 
He ranked the defending champion Duke Blue Devils fourth and North Carolina State Wolfpack 29th. 
Copyright 2015 by Capitol Broadcasting Company. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten or redistributed. Triangle Area Special Offers Bob Posvic Oct 21, 8:26 p.m. 
By this time next year, it should be considerably less than 5 legitimate NCAA Tiles.... Report as abuse Steven Cousler Oct 21, 5:21 p.m. 
UNC was 26-0 in the 1924 season, so yes it is a legit title. Even a roofing company could have made that call, but somehow a tough concept for ABCers. Report as abuse Dustin Baker Oct 21, 5:11 p.m. 
And a Helms Title is not recognized by the NCAA either. So yes the article is wrong. They have five NCAA titles. Report as abuse Dustin Baker Oct 21, 5:01 p.m. 
Ah yes. The infamously 1924 Helms title that was awarded to UNC 12 years after that undefeated season in which they played in no tournament. Even though Butler actually won a tournament that year. Funny that UNC didn't start claiming that title until Duke started catching up. No one claims Helms titles except fans. Kentucky don't even recognize theirs. Keep claiming a title handed out by a bread company. We'll keep laughing. Report as abuse Brandon Shurtz Oct 21, 4:40 p.m. 
View quoted thread 
Mistake in the article, UNC does not have 6 NCAA Championships, they have 5... for the time being.— Posted by jmedwards2 The article is correct. 1924, 1957, 1982, 1993, 2005, and 2009. Last time I checked that adds up to 6. Report as abuse Jm Edwards Oct 21, 4:19 p.m. 
Mistake in the article, UNC does not have 6 NCAA Championships, they have 5... for the time being. Report as abuse NFL: Seattle at San Francisco
